description: Join curator William Rees for a tour of sites in Southall with ties to the Martinware collection; from the location of the Martin brothers' studio on the Grand Union Canal, to the lost fountain of Southall Manor House Grounds, to the home of the collection today at Southall Library, Dominion Centre. Participants will get a free Martinware map and view collection items recently placed on view.

events.name: Guided walking tour
events.notes: This walk will begin at the Dominion Centre and finish at Open Havelock on the Grand Union Canal, which will also be open to visitors.

factsheet.heading: Heritage Walking Tour
paragraphs: Join curator William Rees on a walking tour of sites in Southall, exploring the heritage, lives and works of the Martin brothers. Famous for creating grotesque ceramics in their canal-side studio in Southall, the brothers' work now makes up a significant portion of the Borough's art collection. This walking tour will explore the old studio site, where the brothers lived and famous works from the Collection. Participants will be given a Martinware Trail Map and see the collection display at the Dominion Centre, where works from storage have been put on display for the first time in fifteen years.
